src:
Kapal Pesiar Tandai Pelabuhan Gili Mas Lombok Resmi Beroperasi
05 Nov 2019, 14:25 by Harianto Nukman


Kapal pesiar besar di Pelabuhan Gili Mas (Foto: Dok. Humas Prov NTB)

Lombok Barat - Kapal pesiar berukuran besar bersandar di Pelabuhan Gili Mas, Lombok. Uji coba itu sekaligus menandai pelabuhan ini sekarang sudah resmi beroperasi.Kapal pesiar Sun Princess berukuran 261 meter itu berkapasitas 5.000 orang. Kali ini kapal tersebut mengangkut 2.031 orang wisatawan mancanegara.Wakil Gubernur NTB Sitti Rohmi Djalilah menyaksikan langsung penyandaran kapal pesiar Sun Princess di Pelabuhan Gili Mas, Kecamatan Sekotong, Kabupaten Lombok Barat, Selasa (5/11/2019).


Foto: Dok. Humas Prov NTB

Dalam keterangannya, Sitti Rohmi menyatakan bahwa pihaknya optimistis akan dapat mengejar capaian target kunjungan 4,5 juta wisatawan di tahun 2020 mendatang."Alhamdulillah hari ini adalah hari pertama kali Pelabuhan Gili Mas beroperasi. Bagi kami ini adalah suatu progres yang sangat baik. Tentunya menjadi tantangan bagi kita semua, bagaimana kita melayani tamu-tamu kita dengan sebaik-baiknya," kata dia.


Foto: Dok. Humas Prov NTB

"Telah kita saksikan bersama bahwa hari ini menjadi hari kebanggaan dari masyarakat Nusa Tenggara Barat, dapat kita lihat telah tersandarkan kapal dalam ukuran besar kapal cruise yang mengangkut wisatawan asing. Tentunya ini sebuah potensi yang sangat dibanggakan dan ini juga dapat berpengaruh pada pendapatan daerah terutama pariwisata yang menjadi ikon," ucap Kepala Bagian Hukum dan Kerjasama Luar Negeri Ditjen Perhubungan Laut Kementerian Perhubungan, Hasan Basri, yang mewakili Sekretaris Direktorat Jenderal Perhubungan Laut saat menghadiri Uji Coba Sandar Kapal Cruise di Terminal Gili Mas, Lombok Barat NTB, Selasa (5/11). Simak Video "Kapal Pesiar Greenpeace di Jakarta"[Gambas:Video 20detik](msl/krs)
text:
Cruise Ship Marks Lombok's Gili Mas Port Officially Operates
05 Nov 2019, 14:25 by Harianto Nukman


Large cruise ship at the Port of Gili Mas (Photo: Doc. Humas Province NTB)

West Lombok - Large cruise ships leaning at the Port of Gili Mas, Lombok. The trial also marked that the port is now officially operational. The 261-meter Sun Princess cruise ship has a capacity of 5,000 people. This time the ship was carrying 2,031 foreign tourists. Deputy Governor of NTB Sitti Rohmi Djalilah witnessed the direct leaning of the Sun Princess cruise ship at the Port of Gili Mas, Sekotong District, West Lombok Regency, Tuesday (11/05/2019).


Photo: Doc. NTB Province Public Relations

In his statement, Sitti Rohmi stated that he was optimistic that he would be able to pursue the achievement of the target of 4.5 million tourists in 2020. "Thank God, today is the first day the Gili Mas Port is operating. For us this is a very good progress. the challenge for all of us is how we best serve our guests, "he said.


Photo: Doc. NTB Province Public Relations

"We have witnessed together that today is a day of pride for the people of West Nusa Tenggara, we can see that it has been anchored in large size cruise ships carrying foreign tourists. Surely this is a potential that is very proud of and can also affect regional income, especially tourism which became an icon, "said the Head of Legal Affairs and International Cooperation of the Ministry of Transportation's Directorate General of Sea Transportation, Hasan Basri, who represented the Secretary of the Directorate General of Sea Transportation while attending Cruise Ship Sandar Trials at the Gili Mas Terminal, West Lombok, West Nusa Tenggara, Tuesday (11/5) ). Check out the video "Greenpeace Cruise Ship in Jakarta" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (msl / krs)
